text: {| |} The Stratus EJ 22 is an American aircraft engine, produced by Stratus 2000 of Corvallis, Oregon for use in homebuilt aircraft.Bayerl, Robby; Martin Berkemeier; et al: World Directory of Leisure Aviation 2011-12, pages 240-243. WDLA UK, Lancaster UK, 2011. ISSN 1368-485X ==Design and development== The engine is based upon the Subaru EJ 22 automotive engine. It is a four-cylinder four-stroke, , liquid-cooled, gasoline engine design, with a belt-type reduction drive with a reduction ratio of 2.2:1. It employs electronic ignition and produces at 5900 rpm. The company seems to have gone out of business about 2008 and production ended. ==Specifications (EA 81) == ==See also== ==References== Category:Stratus aircraft engines Category:1990s aircraft piston engines
title: Stratus EJ 22
